title: Thou My Everlasting Portion

author.name: Fanny Crosby
author.bio: Fanny Crosby was one of the most prolific American hymn writers in history, contributing thousands of hymns to the Christian faith, despite being blind from infancy. Known for her deep spiritual insight and lyrical prowess, her hymns have touched millions of lives, conveying themes of hope, faith, and divine guidance. Crosby's work remains a staple in Christian worship, celebrated for its poetic beauty and theological depth. 'Thou My Everlasting Portion' reflects Crosby's intimate relationship with Christ and her desire for spiritual closeness throughout life's journey.

lyrics:
1. Thou, my everlasting portion,
More than friend or life to me;
All along my pilgrim journey,
Savior, let me walk with Thee.

Refrain:
Close to Thee, Close to Thee,
Close to Thee, Close to Thee,
All along this tedious journey,
Savior, let me walk with Thee.

2. Not for ease or worldly pleasure,
Nor for fame my prayer shall be;
Gladly will I toil and suffer,
Only let me walk with Thee. [Refrain]

3. Lead me through the vale of shadows,
Bear me o’er life’s fitful sea,
Then the gate of life eternal,
May I enter, Lord, with Thee.
